unnormalised: BSES Yamuna Power Limited (BYPL) announced a new initiative on 10/10/2024 encouraging consumers in East Delhi to adopt energy-efficient practices. Apparently, the average household bill in the area is about Rs. 2500 per month, which is quite a bit, right? The company wants to bring that down by at least 15% by offering subsidies on LED bulbs and energy-efficient appliances. They’re even running workshops to teach people simple tricks, like unplugging devices when not in use and using natural light whenever possible.
normalised: B-S-E-S Yamuna Power Limited (B-Y-P-L) announced a new initiative on tenth October two thousand and twenty four encouraging consumers in East Delhi to adopt energy-efficient practices. Apparently, the average household bill in the area is about rupee two thousand five hundred per month, which is quite a bit, right? The company wants to bring that down by at least fifteen percent by offering subsidies on L-E-D bulbs and energy-efficient appliances. They're even running workshops to teach people simple tricks, like unplugging devices when not in use and using natural light whenever possible.

unnormalised: BYPL officials have stated that 60% of the energy consumption in most homes comes from appliances like ACs, refrigerators, and geysers. To help manage this, they’re promoting the use of 5-star rated appliances and offering attractive EMI options in partnership with local electronics stores. Plus, did you know simply switching off lights when you leave a room can save around Rs. 50-Rs. 100 a month? Small changes can make a big difference!

unnormalised: The response has been pretty good so far, with over 5000 residents registering for the workshops. BYPL hopes to extend this initiative to other parts of Delhi soon.
